channel.title: Is this reportable?
channel.description: I'm in a game right now and the prince asked everybody to execute me because I had a confirmed merc contracted to me and he wanted the merc to contract him. Is that reportable?

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: TryphonX
item.description: Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: TryphonX
item.description:
JohnnyDeep:

All the Rules listed imply that what the Prince did wasn’t against the rules, and so, not reportable.

It’s an incredibly bad mannered move, but it’s not gamethrowing. His goal wasn’t being lost.

Basically this. Strategies like that are frowned upon, however not against the rules.
So, not reportable.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
the reason you need permission is because they might game throw and say who their team mates are. Everyone knew they were prince, so you couldn’t have revealed him or anything.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: Floofyboy
item.description:
First, you guys are wrongly using the word “bussing”. Bussing can only be done as unseen/cult. Bussing is when you purposely out a partner to gain credibility. What this prince did has NOTHING to do with bussing.

Since you were unclear, his play was arguably good if he had no better choice of execution.

Instead of executing nobody, he executed an unclear, which also resulted in getting protection from the merc AND clearing the merc. Amazing play by that prince if you ask me.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
CN73DRUMMER:

Ergo I would assume devs would say if prince wanted my merc, he’d have to get my perimission to execute me to take my merc.

Nobody needs your permission to execute you in this game. It looks like your team decided this was what they wanted to do and they did it. Threatening to report somebody for executing you is a metagaming angleshoot.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
CN73DRUMMER:

Ergo I would assume devs would say if prince wanted my merc, he’d have to get my perimission to execute me to take my merc. Same concept.

But the key difference is, he effectively put it to a vote with his own team… I agree it was a horrible play. Outing someone as BD isn’t really bussing. Asking BD to vote for someone doesn’t force them to do so, especially if they were knowing they were bussing on behalf of that really dumb jailors plan. Either every non evil that voted to execute the probable physician is guilty, or none of them are.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: Sketch
item.description:
This isn’t reportable.

Whether it was a good idea or not is besides the point.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: CN73DRUMMER
item.description:
Merc ran out of guards prince got killed BD lost and everybody laid into the prince.

Also to the reply from a different person from earlier, the bussing rule was regarding the unseen I know that. But the point was even though unseen bussing unseen might be a good strat for the good of the team, you still need that persons permission to bus them. Ergo I would assume devs would say if prince wanted my merc, he’d have to get my perimission to execute me to take my merc. Same concept.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: newarkinvaders
item.description:
So out of interest , how did this game play out ?

Read full topic

item.description:
Top it off even if he doesn’t get converted… he at best has 2 or 3 uses of his guard left… (as obviously he had to do one to “confirm himself”)

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
newarkinvaders:

Also this is a crap strategy , lets out the prince , kill our healer then watch as our merc gets converted and the prince killed …

  1. it was not specified if prince was revealed or not
  2. it was not specified if they were confirmed (the physician)
  3. it was not specified if there was some king of observer or CW to prevent that

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: newarkinvaders
item.description:
This is not really the prince but the whole team .Weird as anything that this was passed by the team.
When on trial did you make a proper defense ?

Also this is a crap strategy , lets out the prince , kill our healer then watch as our merc gets converted and the prince killed …

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
if you look at the threads it is 1) applying to evil people and 2) they just have to tell you.

In addition, this is a good strategy, and if you try and say no then YOU are the gamethrower.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: Aurelia
item.description:
Trollbox can be annoying but it’s not allowed to use it to make others break the rule, screenshot/report

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?

item.description:
Plot twist. You are the scorned.

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Plot twist. This entire thing was a scorned troll box all along.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
I’d say point blank, “bussing a team” doesn’t really come into play at all here. Bussing is pretty much as evil, you out another evil that you 100% know the identity of. This was a prince outing a probable good (most likely not “confirmed, as pretty much only prince is unconvertable”), to make a play, and it involved more or less the majority of the BD agreeing with the play…

That being said, it’s just bad play IMO… the rest of the BD should have objected or refused, a merc is nice and all, and he’s already used at least one of his protections, and he could be converted to a sellsword or killed to completely negate whatever good that concept had to begin with.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: Weizen1988
item.description:
I dont disagree, some rules should be more clear, im just doing my best to interpret the letter and spirit of the rules since a mod hasnt chimed in at all yet. Killing a member of own team just to get a merc, feels iffy to me is all.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: JohnnyDeep
item.description:
I just don’t like the idea that people could get punished for “rules” that aren’t necessarily fully explained in the game itself. If the Devs didn’t want people sacking their own teammates, surely they’d put that in the game Rules, on the main menu?

edit: I’m not trying to be confrontational, haha! I’m just like seeing less common tactics used in TOL, and also playing devils advocate a little.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: CN73DRUMMER
item.description:
Ty all for your advice!

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: CN73DRUMMER
item.description:
I wasn’t confirmed BD exactly. But I wasn’t accused of being neut or cult. I wasn’t put up for being suspicious at all. He just found out I had a merc and was like oh hey then let’s kill him because I’m prince and I want the merc.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: Weizen1988
item.description:
Full log gets sent with the report, so it will be easy to see who was doing what.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: CN73DRUMMER
item.description:
Yeah I reported and said that I know you can’t bus a teammate without their permission but I’m not sure if this is the same thing. Etc.

and then I had to note that I had no part in all the toxic yelling at the end of the game because a couple people laid into the guy for what he did.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: Weizen1988
item.description:
Were you confirmed as bd at the time, or just confirmed that you had a merc?

Read full topic

item.title: Is this reportable?
item.dc:creator: JohnnyDeep
item.description:
Might I suggest that the rules become slightly less vague, especially since the Prince, in this example, could be considered to be not gamethrowing, since he is using the Mercenary further his investigative abilities.

I understand it’s a really assholey move, but to allow BD to win, some sacrifices might have to be made.

Read full topic
